creator: huang.xingang@gmail.com
text:
I got the following error when compile httpd-2.2.0-win32-src-rev2.zip with MSVC 
6.0.

./include\apr_ldap.h(96) : fatal error C1189: #error :  Support for LDAP v2.0 to
olkits has been removed from apr-util. Please use an LDAP v3.0 toolkit.

One of the differences between the new apr_ldap.h and old one from 2.0.x is

New
#if LDAP_VERSION_MAX <= 2
#error Support for LDAP v2.0 toolkits has been removed from apr-util. Please 
use an LDAP v3.0 toolkit.
#endif 

Old
#if LDAP_VERSION_MAX <= 2
#define const_cast(x) ((char *)(x))
#else
#define const_cast(x) (x)
#endif

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
In fact this error doesn't occur IF you use the current, 2003 or later flavors
of the Microsoft ldap headers.  The problem is that if you use earlier versions,
either because of an old SDK, or Visual Studio 6 or .NET 2002 without a modern
SDK, you ALSO will use a totally foobarred version of the wldap32.lib which
points the ordinal entry points AT THE WRONG FUNCTIONS.

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
(As a footnote, real issues were resolved all the way through apr-1.2.7 and this
should be your minimum baseline for compiling httpd 2.2.  It will be included
in the httpd 2.2.2 bundle coming very shortly.)
